## Natural history notes

The Creeping Little Bluestem (Schizachyrium stoloniferum) is a tall perennial, with long creeping rootstocks and long extravaginal innovations. The genus Schizachyrium means “split chaff,” referring to the split lemma of its spikelets. As a warm-season grass, it provides forage for wildlife and stabilizes sandy soils in its native range.
